protocol_name: Protocol A: Preparation of endotoxin-free carrier DNA for transfection
protocol_name_html: Protocol A: Preparation of endotoxin-free carrier DNA for transfection

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

components.data:
• Transform plasmid according to standard protocols

• Luria-Bertani broth (Miller Formula) with 50 µg/ml carbenecillin or 100 µg/ml ampicillin

• Grow at 37°C
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• Transform plasmid according to standard protocols

• Luria-Bertani broth (Miller Formula) with 50 µg/ml carbenecillin or 100 µg/ml ampicillin

• Grow at 37°C

components.data: Grow an overnight culture of DH5alpha E. coli transformed with pUC19 in LB
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Grow an overnight culture of DH5alpha E. coli transformed with pUC19 in LB

components.data:
• 1L Superbroth: 15 mM MgCl2, 32 g Peptone, 20 g Yeast Extract, 5 g NaCl

• Innoculate 2 ml of overnight culture per liter of superbroth

• Grow in 2.8-liter, baffled Fernbach flasks at 37°C and 200 rpm for 16 hours
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• 1L Superbroth: 15 mM MgCl2, 32 g Peptone, 20 g Yeast Extract, 5 g NaCl

components.data:
• Discard supernatant

• Use immediately for DNA purification or store long term by flash freezing pelletin liquid nitrogen and storing at -80°C

• Purify according to manufacturers instructions

components.data: Purify DNA using Qiagen or Zymo Gigaprep Kit

source_data.section: Purify DNA using Qiagen or Zymo Gigaprep Kit

components.data:
• Add one-tenth the volume of 3 M Sodium Acetate, pH 5.2 to one volume of DNA

• Add 2.5 volumes of ethanol to the solution of DNA and sodium acetate 

• Mix well

• Pellet DNA by spinning for 30 min at ~20,000xg and 4°C

• Discard supernatant

• Resuspend pellet in one-tenth the original volume with 10 mM Tris-Acetate, pH 8.0

• If some DNA is still not soluble, spin the sample for 10 min at ~20,000xg and 4°C and keep the supernatant
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• Add one-tenth the volume of 3 M Sodium Acetate, pH 5.2 to one volume of DNA

• Add 2.5 volumes of ethanol to the solution of DNA and sodium acetate 

• Mix well

• Pellet DNA by spinning for 30 min at ~20,000xg and 4°C

• Discard supernatant

• Resuspend pellet in one-tenth the original volume with 10 mM Tris-Acetate, pH 8.0

• If some DNA is still not soluble, spin the sample for 10 min at ~20,000xg and 4°C and keep the supernatant

components.data: Concentrate DNA with and ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Concentrate DNA with and ethanol precipitation

components.data:
• To 100 µl restriction of DNA, add 750 µl of 5 M NaCl and 750 µl of 40% (w/v) PEG 8000 and mix well.

• Incubate at -20°C for ≥1 h

• Pellet DNA by spinning for 30 min at ~20,000xg and 4°C.

• Remove supernatant and resuspend pellet in 100 µl of 10 mM Tris-Acetate, pH 8.0

• Repeat PEG precipitation.

• After the second precipitation, resuspend the plasmid in 200 µl of 300 mM Sodium Acetate, pH 5.2

• Add 500 µl of 200 proof ethanol

• Incubate at -20°C for 30 min

• Pellet DNA by spinning for 30 min at ~20,000xg and 4°C

• Discard superntant and resuspend the pellet in a minimal volume of 10 mM Tris-acetate, pH 8.0 that has been filtered through a 0.22 µm filter
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• To 100 µl restriction of DNA, add 750 µl of 5 M NaCl and 750 µl of 40% (w/v) PEG 8000 and mix well.

• Incubate at -20°C for ≥1 h

• Pellet DNA by spinning for 30 min at ~20,000xg and 4°C.

• Remove supernatant and resuspend pellet in 100 µl of 10 mM Tris-Acetate, pH 8.0

• Repeat PEG precipitation.

• After the second precipitation, resuspend the plasmid in 200 µl of 300 mM Sodium Acetate, pH 5.2

• Add 500 µl of 200 proof ethanol

• Incubate at -20°C for 30 min

• Pellet DNA by spinning for 30 min at ~20,000xg and 4°C

• Discard superntant and resuspend the pellet in a minimal volume of 10 mM Tris-acetate, pH 8.0 that has been filtered through a 0.22 µm filter

components.data: Remove residual endotoxin (lipopolysaccharide) with a PEG precipitation of DNA
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Remove residual endotoxin (lipopolysaccharide) with a PEG precipitation of DNA

components.data:
• Prepare a small aliquot of twenty-fold dilution of DNA for spectrophotometry

• Quantify the DNA by UV-Vis spectrophotometry using the approximation of 1 OD at 260 nm = 50 ng/µl of DNA

• Adjust the volume of DNA for final conentration of 20 µg/µl.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• Prepare a small aliquot of twenty-fold dilution of DNA for spectrophotometry

• Quantify the DNA by UV-Vis spectrophotometry using the approximation of 1 OD at 260 nm = 50 ng/µl of DNA

• Adjust the volume of DNA for final conentration of 20 µg/µl.

components.data: It is far more cost and time effective to purchase DNA from a manufacturer according to your specifications. We have previously purchased DNA from Nature Technology (http://www.natx.com). Please note that S. rosetta is very senstive to EDTA. Make sure to have your DNA resuspended in a buffer without EDTA
components.name: Description

source_data.description: It is far more cost and time effective to purchase DNA from a manufacturer according to your specifications. We have previously purchased DNA from Nature Technology (http://www.natx.com). Please note that S. rosetta is very senstive to EDTA. Make sure to have your DNA resuspended in a buffer without EDTA
